jobDescription: Job DescriptionPosition Description/Overview: Ford Motor Company's Global Data, Insight, and Analytics (GDI&A;) organization is looking for motivated and talented individuals with a background in advanced analytics such as Optimization, Machine Learning, and Statistics. This is an opportunity to learn and apply the latest tools and methods in data science to a variety of interesting and challenging business problems at Ford. Recent projects in this group have led to the development of applications in the areas of product complexity management, capacity planning, production scheduling, and other business opportunities in Manufacturing and Supply Chain Management. The successful candidate will work as a member of the Order-to-Delivery Analytics team and develop advanced analytics models to support Fords activities in inventory strategy, demand forecast, order generation, scheduling, logistics, supply chain optimization, and more. Responsibilities:Communicate with business partners to understand the business opportunities and translate high-level ideas into well-defined mathematical formulationsPinpoint which elements of sample datasets can be most effectively leveraged in analytics models and what potentially useful information may be missingDevelop and implement advanced analytics algorithms and computationally efficient methods for obtaining optimal or near-optimal solutionsDesign and implement heuristic algorithms for obtaining feasible solutions quicklyDevelop complete system designs that include data, pre-processing, model building, post-processing, and user interfacesEffectively and frequently communicate with business customers and GDI&A; management. Ability to explain highly technical contents with non-technical people is a mustJob RequirementsBasic Qualifications:Master in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Physics or other related technical areas2+ years of experience in applications of optimization, statistics, and/or machine learning to time series, forecasting, scheduling, supply chain, or other related business areas1+ years of experience with database queries such as Hadoop or SQL1+ years of experience with programming languages such as R, Python, Java or TensorFlow1+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as QlickVIew or TableauPreferred Qualifications:PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or other related technical areasKnowledge and experience in Supply Chain Management especially in Order To Delivery processes and systemsProficiency in developing prototype software applications using Java (preferred), C/C++, or similar languages and frameworksProject management experienceComfortable working in an environment where problems are not always well-definedInquisitive, proactive, and interested in learning new tools and techniquesStrong oral, written and interpersonal communication skillsWell-organized, independent and ready to work with minimal supervisionKnowledge and experience in Supply Chain Management especially in Order To Delivery processes and systemsProficiency in developing prototype software applications using Java (preferred), C/C++, or similar languages and frameworksProject management experience The distance between imagination and creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance.
